item.title: Troubles Mount for the ‘British Biased Corporation’
item.description: Amid the resignation of senior BBC officials, the debate on how to save the broadcaster rages on.

item.title: Republicans Have a Young Voter Problem
item.description: Their struggle with young women is comparable to — or even worse than — the Democrats’ difficulties with young men.

item.title: Democrats’ Misguided Response to Trump’s Venezuela Policy
item.description: Driven by anti-Trump rhetoric, many Democrats have become unwilling — or unable — to stand with Venezuela’s fight for freedom.

item.title: Teen Vogue Died a Long Time Ago
item.description: By embracing radical political activism, the publication deserted the age group it was created to serve.

item.title: A Contradictory Composer’s Spiritual Devotion to Craft
item.description: British musicologist Emily Kilpatrick’s biography of French composer Maurice Ravel succeeds because it mirrors Ravel’s own approach to work.
